preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: PHPurple is the libpurple php binding, which makes the use of the instant messaging protocols such AIM (ICQ, Oscar), MSN, Yahoo etc. within php possible. Learn more about the libpurple at http://developer.pidgin.im/wiki/WhatIsLibpurple. libpurple docs can be found at http://developer.pidgin.im/doxygen/dev/html/files.html

Normally, the PHPurple is using the g_main_loop_run() function from the GLib to run the main loop. This makes impossible to use it within some webserver process. One of the possible models to use the extension for some web application could be AJAX web interface, which communicates with the PHPurple through the inetd sevice.
The last development news can be found at http://thinker.rubay.de/ or at http://sourceforge.net/projects/phpurple/

chapter.title: Requirements
chapter.para:
The common requirements are:
PHP >=5.2.0 with pcre compiled in libpurple >= 2.2.1 GLib >= 2.0
Please let us know, if you've successfully compiled on earlier versions. Actually the extension is being developed on the php v5.2.5 with the option to be upcomming php v5.3 compatible.

chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: If you compile the libpurple from scratch, you could use the following configure options:
This will compile only libpurple. Otherwise, if you have already pidgin installed, the libpurple is normally present in the /usr/lib or /usr/local/lib.
Since the extension is installed, you can simply add a line in your php.ini with which it'll be loaded by default. An other way would be to use the dl() php function at the top of your script
Note, that since the windows variant isn't exists yet, there are no installation instructions for this.

example.programlisting:
<?php
		if(!extension_loaded('purple')) {
		dl('purple.' . PHP_SHLIB_SUFFIX);
		}
		
		class CustomPurpleClient extends PurpleClient {
		
			private $someVar;
		
			protected function initInternal()
			{
				$this->someVar = "Hello World";
			}
			
			protected function writeIM($conversation, $buddy, $message, $flags, $time)
			{
				if(PurpleClient::MESSAGE_RECV == $flags) {
					printf(	"(%s) %s %s: %s\n",
								$conversation->getName() ? $conversation->getName() : $buddy->getName(),
								date("H:i:s", $time),
								is_object($buddy) ? $buddy->getAlias() : $buddy,
								$message
						);
				}
			}
			
			protected function onSignedOn($connection)
			{
				print $this->justForFun($this->someVar);
			}
			
			public function justForFun($param)
			{
				return "just for fun, the param is: $param";
			}
		}
		
		try {
	
			$user_dir = "/tmp/phpurple-test";
			if(!file_exists($user_dir) || !is_dir($user_dir)) {
				mkdir($user_dir);
			}
		
			PurpleClient::setUserDir($user_dir);
		
			PurpleBuddyList::load();
		
			$client = CustomPurpleClient::getInstance();
			
			$client->addAccount("msn://nick@hotmail.com:password@messenger.hotmail.com:1863");
			
			$client->connectToSignal("signed-on");
	
			$client->runLoop();
		} catch (Exception $e) {
			echo "[Purple]: " . $e->getMessage() . "\n";
			die();
		}
?>
